Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.cyphy.hem2020e3.equipments.meter.sil Description

Electric meter SIL models for the Household Energy Management example.

The fact that you are presently reading this means that you have had knowledge of the CeCILL-C license and that you accept its terms.

This package defines the electric meter SIL simulation models for the corresponding component in the Household Energy Management example in a SIL simulation mode. The purpose of the electric meter in the example is to sum up the electricity consumptions of the appliances and provide a way for the energy manager to get the current total consumed intensity.

The base model for the electric meter is a HIOA that imports the variables representing the consumption of every appliance and sum them up in its own variable giving the total consumption. Hence, models representing the electricity consumption of appliances and the one for the electric meter must share continuous variables and, as such, they are forced by the BCM/DEVS rules to be co-located into a single component. Hence, the local simulation architecture of the electric meter is made up of all of these models composed into a coupled model that must import all of the events that are required by each appliance model.

To add a new appliance, its electricity consumption model must be added to the local simulation architecture in the class ElectricMeterRTAtomicSimulatorPlugin as submodel of the coupled model and its imported events as imported events of this coupled model.
